alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 16 at 8:54AM CDT until April 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Benton, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison, Sebastian and Washington. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Delaware, Le Flore and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be common, with locally higher amounts possible through early afternoon as a swath of heavy rainfall sets up across a portion of the watch area in response to a cold front moving through the region. This rainfall on top of recent rains could increase flooding concerns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Le Flore; Sequoyah
